metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23559 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In rndis_query_oid in drivers/net/wireless/rndis_wlan.c in the Linux kernel through 6.1.5, there is an integer overflow in an addition. It was discovered that the RNDIS USB driver in the Linux kernel contained an integer overflow vulnerability. A local attacker with physical access could plug in a malicious USB device to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> USN-5975-1 first publication included esm/xenial linux-gcp version 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1 by mistake, it got fixed in version 4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1 as published in USN-6009-1.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
